p: The SNS is tonically active [ 101] and plays key roles in patterned alterations in the distribution of the cardiac output among the vascular beds during activities of daily life such as standing up [ 101], eating a meal, mild exercise [ 158], the Valsalva maneuver, and adjustments to altered environmental temperatures. In addition to the cardiovascular system, SNS outflows to the irises, sweat glands, gastrointestinal tract, and pancreas, and kidneys play important “housekeeping” roles.
